phrases.usage: Use this to start telling someone about your morning tasks.
phrases.example: This morning, I arrived at the office very early today.

phrases.usage: Say this when you want to report a completed task.
phrases.example: I finished the long report before my first coffee break.

phrases.usage: Use this to mention digital communication you handled earlier today.
phrases.example: I sent an email to my manager about the project.

phrases.usage: Mention the specific location where you spent your work time.
phrases.example: I worked in the quiet library for a few hours.

phrases.usage: Use this to give a specific time for an activity.
phrases.example: At ten, I had a short meeting with my team.

phrases.usage: Use this word to show the next step in sequence.
phrases.example: Then I organized some important documents on my wooden desk.

phrases.usage: Describe the atmosphere or workload of your morning work session.
phrases.example: It was busy because many customers called the office today.

phrases.usage: Use this to move to the next event in order.
phrases.example: After that, I ate a quick lunch in the cafeteria.

keyVocabulary.definition: Having a lot of work or things to do.
Doing a lot of useful work during the day.
Having little noise or not many people around.
Something that matters a lot or needs focus.
Useful or making a situation better for someone.
